option.name: fileSummaryMaps
option.value: {"C:/Users/Jackson/AndroidStudioProjects/MeuHolerite":"{\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/utils/PdfReader.kt\":\"This file contains a single class and two functions:\\n\\n`PdfReader`: A class that provides functionality to extract text from a PDF file using the PDFBox library.\\n\\n`extractTextFromUri`: A function that takes a URI of a PDF file, opens the file, extracts the text using the PDFBox library, and returns the extracted text as a string.\\n\\nThe file is responsible for providing a utility class to read and extract text from PDF files in an Android application.\",\"/app/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle build script for an Android application. It defines the plugins, Android configuration, and dependencies for the project. There are no explicit classes or functions defined in this file. Instead, it configures the build process and specifies the libraries and tools to be used in the project.\\n\\nThe key elements of this build script are:\\n\\n`plugins`: Specifies the Android application, Kotlin, and Kotlin Compose plugins to be used in the project.\\n`android`: Configures the Android-specific settings, such as the namespace, compile SDK version, default app settings, and build types.\\n`dependencies`: Declares the dependencies for the project, including Android core libraries, Compose UI components, PDF library, JSON serialization, and Room database.\",\"/app/src/test/java/com/jack/meuholerite/ExampleUnitTest.kt\":\"This file contains a single unit test class with one test function. The file does not define any classes or functions, but rather contains a single unit test that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 is correct.\\n\\n`ExampleUnitTest`: A unit test class that contains a single test function to verify the correctness of a simple addition operation.\\n\\n`addition_isCorrect()`: A test function that checks if the addition of 2 and 2 is equal to 4, which is the expected result.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/ui/theme/Type.kt\":\"This file defines the typography styles for a Jetpack Compose-based Android application. It sets the default text style for the `bodyLarge` component, and provides commented-out examples for other text styles such as `titleLarge` and `labelSmall`.\\n\\n`Typography`: Defines the set of Material typography styles to be used in the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/ui/theme/Color.kt\":\"This file defines a set of color values for a Compose UI theme. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather defines a set of color constants that can be used throughout the application.\\n\\n`Purple80`: A dark purple color.\\n`PurpleGrey80`: A dark purple-grey color.\\n`Pink80`: A dark pink color.\\n`Purple40`: A lighter purple color.\\n`PurpleGrey40`: A lighter purple-grey color.\\n`Pink40`: A lighter pink color.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/model/EspelhoPonto.kt\":\"This file contains two data classes:\\n\\n`EspelhoItem`: A data class that represents an item in an employee\\u0027s payslip, with a label, value, and a flag indicating if the value is negative.\\n\\n`EspelhoPonto`: A data class that represents an employee\\u0027s payslip, with information about the employee, the period, a list of `EspelhoItem` objects, the final and period balances, details about the balance, a flag indicating if there were any absences, a list of absence days, and an optional PDF file path.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions, but rather defines the structure of the data that will be used in the application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/model/ReciboPagamento.kt\":\"This file contains two data classes:\\n\\n`ReciboPagamento`: A data class that represents a payment receipt, containing information about the employee, payment period, company, proventos (earnings), descontos (deductions), and other financial details.\\n\\n`ReciboItem`: A data class that represents an individual item in the payment receipt, containing information about the code, description, reference, value, and optional details.\\n\\nThis file does not contain any functions. It is a data model that defines the structure of a payment receipt and its individual items.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/MainActivity.kt\":\"This file is an Android Compose-based application that displays and manages employee payroll and timesheet information. It includes the following classes and functions:\\n\\n`MainActivity`: The main activity that sets up the Compose-based UI.\\n\\n`IosTopBar`: Composable function that creates the top bar with user information and menu options.\\n\\n`MainScreen`: Composable function that manages the main screen and its various sections.\\n\\n`AbsenceWarningDialog`: Composable function that displays a dialog warning about detected absences.\\n\\n`DeductionDetailDialog`: Composable function that displays a dialog with details about a selected deduction.\\n\\n`OnboardingDialog`: Composable function that displays a dialog for the user to enter their name and employee ID.\\n\\n`TimesheetScreen`: Composable function that displays the timesheet information and history.\\n\\n`ReceiptsScreen`: Composable function that displays the payroll receipt information and history.\\n\\n`EpaysWebViewPage`: Composable function that displays a WebView for the ePays portal and handles PDF downloads.\\n\\n`UpdatePromptDialog`: Composable function that displays a dialog prompting the user to update the app.\\n\\n`HomeScreen`: Composable function that displays the main home screen with summary information.\\n\\n`IosWidgetTimesheetFullCard`: Composable function that creates a full-width timesheet card.\\n\\n`IosWidgetReceiptFullCard`: Composable function that creates a full-width receipt card.\\n\\n`IosWidgetSmallInfoCard`: Composable function that creates a small information card.\\n\\n`IosWidgetFinanceWideCard`: Composable function that creates a wide finance card.\\n\\n`IosWidgetSummaryLargeCard`: Composable function that creates a large summary card.\\n\\n`SummaryItem`: Composable function that creates a summary item within a card.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/utils/StorageManager.kt\":\"This file contains a single class and several functions:\\n\\n`StorageManager`: A class that provides methods for saving, retrieving, and clearing data related to an `EspelhoPonto` object in the application\\u0027s shared preferences.\\n\\n`saveEspelho`: Saves the provided `EspelhoPonto` object as a JSON string in the shared preferences.\\n\\n`getSavedEspelho`: Retrieves the saved `EspelhoPonto` object from the shared preferences, if it exists.\\n\\n`clearData`: Removes the saved `EspelhoPonto` object from the shared preferences.\\n\\nThis file is responsible for managing the storage and retrieval of an `EspelhoPonto` object in the application\\u0027s shared preferences, which is a common way to store small amounts of data on an Android device.\",\"/build.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a top-level build file that sets up common configuration options for all sub-projects or modules in the Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but instead, it sets up the necessary plugins for the project, including the Android application plugin, the Kotlin Android plugin, and the Kotlin Compose plugin.\\n\\nThe purpose of this file is to provide a centralized location for defining common build settings and dependencies that can be shared across all the sub-projects or modules in the Android application.\",\"/app/release/output-metadata.json\":\"This file appears to be a JSON configuration file for an Android application. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather provides information about the application\\u0027s version, build settings, and baseline profiles. Here\\u0027s a summary of the key elements in the file:\\n\\n`version`: Specifies the version of the configuration file.\\n`artifactType`: Indicates that the artifact type is an APK (Android Package) and the kind is a Directory.\\n`applicationId`: The unique identifier for the Android application.\\n`variantName`: The name of the build variant, in this case, \\\"release\\\".\\n`elements`: Provides details about a single output file, including the version code, version name, and the output file name.\\n`baselineProfiles`: Defines two baseline profiles, one for Android API levels 28-30 and another for API level 31 and above, each with a corresponding baseline profile file.\\n`minSdkVersionForDexing`: The minimum Android SDK version required for the application to run.\",\"/app/src/androidTest/java/com/jack/meuholerite/ExampleInstrumentedTest.kt\":\"This file contains an instrumented test for an Android app. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather a single test case that checks if the app\\u0027s package name matches the expected value.\\n\\nThe file can be summarized as follows:\\n\\nThe `ExampleInstrumentedTest` class is an instrumented test that runs on an Android device and checks if the package name of the app under test matches the expected value.\\n\\nThe `useAppContext()` function is a test case that retrieves the context of the app under test and asserts that the package name matches the expected value.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/AboutDialog.kt\":\"This file contains a Compose-based UI component for displaying an \\\"About\\\" dialog. It includes the following:\\n\\n`AboutDialog`: A composable function that displays an AlertDialog with information about the app, including the developer\\u0027s name, phone, email, and the app version.\\n\\n`AboutInfoRow`: A composable function that displays a row of information with an icon, label, and value.\\n\\nThe file provides a reusable UI component for displaying an \\\"About\\\" dialog in a Compose-based Android application.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/database/AppDatabase.kt\":\"This file contains the Room database implementation for the \\\"Meu Holerite\\\" application, which includes entities for Espelho (payslip) and Recibo (receipt) data, as well as their corresponding DAOs and database class.\\n\\n`EspelhoEntity`: Represents the Espelho (payslip) data stored in the database.\\n\\n`ReciboEntity`: Represents the Recibo (receipt) data stored in the database.\\n\\n`EspelhoDao`: Provides CRUD operations for the Espelho (payslip) data.\\n\\n`ReciboDao`: Provides CRUD operations for the Recibo (receipt) data.\\n\\n`AppDatabase`: The main Room database class that manages the Espelho and Recibo entities.\\n\\n`toEntity` (for Espelho and Recibo): Converts the model classes to their corresponding database entity classes.\\n\\n`toModel` (for Espelho and Recibo): Converts the database entity classes to their corresponding model classes.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/parser/ReciboParser.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `ReciboParser`, which is responsible for parsing a text representation of a payroll receipt and extracting relevant information from it.\\n\\n`ReciboParser`: A class that parses a text representation of a payroll receipt and extracts information such as the employee\\u0027s name, employee ID, payment period, payment date, earnings, deductions, and various totals.\\n\\n`parse`: A function that takes a string representing the payroll receipt text and returns a `ReciboPagamento` object containing the parsed information.\\n\\n`getDetailForItem`: A helper function that provides a description for a specific payroll item based on its code and description.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/parser/PontoParser.kt\":\"This file contains a single class, `PontoParser`, which is responsible for parsing a text representation of an employee\\u0027s time record and extracting relevant information such as the employee\\u0027s name, the time period, the various time-related metrics, and the overall balance of hours worked.\\n\\n`PontoParser`: A class that parses a text representation of an employee\\u0027s time record and extracts relevant information.\\n\\n`parse(text: String): EspelhoPonto`: Parses the given text and returns an `EspelhoPonto` object containing the parsed information.\\n\\n`formatTime(time: String): String`: Formats a time string in the format \\\"HH:mm\\\" and handles negative values.\",\"/app/src/main/java/com/jack/meuholerite/ui/theme/Theme.kt\":\"This file defines the theme for the \\\"MeuHolerite\\\" Android app using Jetpack Compose.\\n\\n`DarkColorScheme`: Defines the dark color scheme for the app.\\n\\n`LightColorScheme`: Defines the light color scheme for the app.\\n\\n`MeuHoleriteTheme`: A composable function that sets the theme for the app based on the system\\u0027s dark mode setting and the device\\u0027s Android version.\",\"/README.md\":\"This file appears to be a README.md file for an Android application called \\\"Meu Holerite\\\". It does not contain any class or function definitions, but rather provides an overview of the application\\u0027s features, technologies used, and instructions for running the project. The file summarizes the following:\\n\\n1. The application is a modern Android app developed to facilitate the management and visualization of payslips (holerites) and work shift records from PDF files.\\n\\n2. The application automates the extraction of data from PDF documents, allowing the user to track their financial history, bank hour balance, and work schedule details in an intuitive and organized manner.\\n\\n3. The application supports various features such as PDF import, financial summary, work time control, bank hour management, history tracking, theme support, and local data storage using Room Database.\\n\\n4. The application is developed using Kotlin, Jetpack Compose, Room Persistence Library, PDFBox Android, Gson, and KSP (Kotlin Symbol Processing).\\n\\n5. The file provides instructions for cloning the repository, opening the project in Android Studio, and running the application on an emulator or physical device.\\n\\n6. The file also includes information about the developer, the current version of the application, and the MIT license under which the project is released.\",\"/settings.gradle.kts\":\"This file is a Gradle configuration file for an Android project. It does not contain any classes or functions, but rather configures the project\\u0027s build settings and dependencies.\\n\\n`pluginManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving Gradle plugins.\\n`dependencyResolutionManagement`: Configures the repositories to be used for resolving project dependencies.\\n`rootProject.name`: Sets the name of the root project to \\\"Meu Holerite\\\".\\n`include(\\\":app\\\")`: Includes the \\\":app\\\" module in the project.\\n\\nThe file sets up the necessary repositories for the project, including Google\\u0027s Maven repository, Maven Central, and the Gradle Plugin Portal. It also configures the project to fail if any project-specific repositories are used, ensuring that all dependencies are resolved from the configured repositories.\"}"}
